alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Mason (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 2:59PM EST until February 16 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and runoff. * WHERE...Portions of Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Kentucky, Bracken, Lewis, Mason and Robertson. In Ohio, Adams, Brown and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 257 PM EST, the public reported flooding along KY-989 between mile makers 1.2 and 7.3. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Portsmouth, Maysville, Wheelersburg, Washington, West Union, New Boston, Manchester, Ripley, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, Greenup, South Webster, Lewisburg, Rome, Tollesboro, Camp Dix, Head of Grassy, Rosemount, Sciotodale and Franklin Furnace.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
